node.title: Rieko Ioane moves to centre, Havili benched for All Blacks v Ireland test
node.description: Only one player has kept their starting spot from last week's win over Italy.
node.content: ["All Blacks coach Ian Foster has made a major change to his strongest possible side, having named his matchday 23 to face Ireland in Dublin on Sunday (NZ time).", "In a midfield re-jig, Rieko Ioane has been named in the No. 13 jersey, with Anton Lienert-Brown moving infield to second-five. David Havili has been moved to the bench to accommodate the new starting midfield pair.", "Sevu Reece is the only player to retain his starting position from the 47-9 victory over Italy in Rome, but shifts from the right wing to the left in order to accommodate Ioane's switch to midfield.", "The rest of the starting XV sees Foster continue with his strongest possible side, that defeated Wales 54-16 in Cardiff.", "The trio of Joe Moody, Codie Taylor and Nepo Laulala make up the front row, with Brodie Retallick and Sam Whitelock in at lock to complete the tight five.", "Ethan Blackadder starts on the blindside flank of the scrum, as Dalton Papalii keeps hold of the No. 7 jersey, with Ardie Savea staying at No. 8.\u00a0", "TJ Perenara and newly minted test centurion Beauden Barrett make up the halves combination, with Finlay Christie moving onto the bench after Brad Weber suffered a concussion against Italy. Aaron Smith has not been included after his arrival from New Zealand earlier this week.", "Will Jordan returns to the right wing, while Jordie Barrett starts at fullback along with Reece to complete the outside backs.", "On the bench, Dane Coles has won the race to take the role of reserve hooker, after both he and Asafo Aumua scored try doubles in the win over Italy.", "There was however no room among the reserves for Sam Cane, who played the full 80 minutes in the win over Italy in his bid to return to full fitness.", "Sunday's test against Ireland is the All Blacks' penultimate game of 2021, finishing their season against France in Paris next week.", "All Blacks: 1-Joe Moody, 2-Codie Taylor, 3-Nepo Laulala, 4-Brodie Retallick, 5-Sam Whitelock (c), 6-Ethan Blackadder, 7-Dalton Papalii, 8-Ardie Savea, 9-TJ Perenara, 10-Beauden Barrett, 11-Sevu Reece, 12-Anton Lienert-Brown, 13-Rieko Ioane, 14-Will Jordan, 15-Jordie Barrett", "Reserves: 16-Dane Coles, 17-Karl Tu'inukuafe, 18-Tyrel Lomax, 19-Tupou Vaa'i, 20-Akira Ioane, 21-Final Christie, 22-Richie Mo'unga, 23-David Havili", "Join Newshub for live updates of the All Blacks v Ireland from 4am Sunday."]
